item.title: Xbox Game Pass Wave 1 Titles For November 2024 Revealed
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/xbox-game-pass-wave-1-titles-november-2024-revealed/

Xbox Game Pass will be providing players with Metal Slug Tactics, Go Mecha Ball, Harold Halibut, the Rewinder, Turnip Robs a Bank, Goat Simulator Remastered, and Microsoft Flight Simulator 2024 as the first wave of games for November 2024. 

Metal Slug Tactics arrives as a Day One game for Game Pass Ultimate and PC Game Pass users on November 4. With this title, players will experience dynamic tactical RPG systems, roguelike excitement, and redefined run-n-gun action. 

Then, on November 6, Game Pass Standard users will be able to enjoy four new games, including the shoot-em-up title Go Mecha Ball; the handmade narrative-based adventure Harold Halibut; a 2D puzzle adventure inspired by Chinese folklore, the Rewinder; and lastly, the 2D action-adventure Turnip Boy Robs a Bank. 

Next, on November 7, Game Pass Ultimate and PC Game Pass players will be able to enjoy a cult classic, Goat Simulator Remastered. The game features wacky physics, upgraded visuals, and DLC expansions.

Last but not least, Microsoft Flight Simulator 2024 will be available for Game Pass Ultimate and PC Game Pass users on Day One, November 19. Players can enjoy “dynamically generated missions, compete against other pilots, and explore the most detailed digital twin of the world to date” with the latest instalment. 

Game Pass Titles Leaving in November 2024

There are seven games that players will no longer be able to access through their Game Pass library after November 15. These include Dicey Dungeons, Dungeons 4, Goat Simulator, Like a Dragon: Ishin!, Like a Dragon: The Man Who Erased His Name, Person 5 Tactica and Somerville. 

In other news, Wolverine’s Creative Director has joined Xbox’s Perfect Dark Team. Also, learn more about the new Xbox Wireless Headset. What are your titles on the Xbox Game Pass Wave 1 titles for November 2024? Let us know in the comments or our new community forum!
